title: Reproducible Computation At Scale In R With {targets}
text:

title: Analyse Spatiale Sous R, Avec Lâ€™Extension {sf}
text:

Analyse Spatiale Sous R, Avec Lâ€™Extension {sf}






[RÃ©sumÃ©]
Bien quâ€™initialement non conÃ§us spÃ©cifiquement pour lâ€™analyse spatiale, un certain nombre de packages ont Ã©mergÃ© sur le logiciel R.
Les trois principaux sont {rgdal} qui permettait dâ€™importer des donnÃ©es spatiales (shapefile, â€¦), {sp} qui fournit les outils pour analyser les donnÃ©es, les mettre en formes, etc., et {rgeos} qui permet les opÃ©rations de > SIG classique (calculs de distances, calculs de pÃ©rimÃ¨tre, intersection, etc.).
Le package {sf} pour â€œsimple featureâ€ est un package de simplification. Il permet dâ€™exploiter tous les types de donnÃ©es spatiales que ce soit des analyses de points, des dÃ©coupages administratifs ou encore des grilles. GrÃ¢ce Ã  sa panoplie rationalisÃ©e de fonction, il permet avec un minimum de fonctions dâ€™importer/exporter, de manipuler/traiter les donnÃ©es et de les prÃ©senter de faÃ§on simple. Et tout cela en un seul package au lieu de trois auparavant!
Ã€ cela sâ€™ajoute sa syntaxe claire et normÃ©e, ainsi toutes ses fonctions commenÃ§ant par â€œst_â€ sont faciles Ã  retrouver.
Si le format des donnÃ©es peut paraÃ®tre complexe au premier abord, il interagit facilement avec dâ€™autres packages. Ainsi, la sÃ©lection dâ€™observation est facilitÃ©e avec le package {dplyr} et la visualisation des donnÃ©es est aisÃ©e via â€œggplotâ€.

title: Memory- and Computation-Efficient Statistical Tools for Big Matrices
text:
R Lille organise un nouveau MeetUpÂ :
Memory- and Computation-Efficient Statistical Tools for Big Matrices
Celui-ci sera prÃ©sentÃ© par Florian PrivÃ© et aura lieu le Thursday, the 7th of April, 2022 - 18:00 CET.






[RÃ©sumÃ©]
R package {bigstatsr} (https://github.com/privefl/bigstatsr) provides functions for fast statistical analysis of large-scale data encoded as matrices. The package can handle matrices that are too large to fit in memory. The Package {bigstatsr} is based on a similar format (called FBM) as the format big.matrix provided by the R package {bigmemory}. The Package {bigstatsr} enables users with a laptop to perform statistical analysis of several dozens of gigabytes of data, and HPC users to handle matrices of hundreds of GB. The package is fast and efficient because of four different reasons. First, {bigstatsr} is memory-efficient because it uses only small chunks of data at a time. Second, special care has been taken to implement effective algorithms. Third, FBM objects use memory-mapping, which provides efficient accesses to matrices. Finally, as matrices are stored on-disk, many processes can easily access them in parallel.
The main features currently available in {bigstatsr} are:

truncated SVD/PCA,
penalized linear/logistic regressions,
column-wise linear/logistic regressions tests,
matrix operations,
parallelization / split-apply-combine stategy.

In this webinar, I will present this package and its features, as well as quickly present two other packages, {bigsparser}, which provides an on-disk sparse matrix format, and {bigsnpr}, which extends {bigstatsr} to provide specific tools for analyzing genotype data.
[Bio]
Florian PrivÃ© is a senior researcher in predictive human genetics, fond of Data Science and an R(cpp) enthusiast. He is also the founder and former organizer of the Grenoble R user group. You can find him on Twitter and GitHub as @privefl.
[A Propos]
This event (in English) is organised by the R Lille user group (https://rlille.fr/) (Lille, France). The meetup will be recorded and made available on YouTube (http://youtube.rlille.fr/).

Les inscriptions sont sur MeetupÂ : http://meetup.rlille.fr/events/284358899
Lâ€™ensemble des diapositives sera mis Ã  disposition sur le GitHub du groupeÂ : https://github.com/RLille/meetups/tree/main/meetups/2022-04-07/materials
Le Meetup sera enregistrÃ© et diffusÃ© sur Youtube (http://youtube.rlille.fr/).
Ã€ bientÃ´tÂ !
MickaÃ«l CANOUIL
